alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cumberland; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 7:50PM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations up to 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Sagadahoc and Coastal Cumberland Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of heavy snow is likely along the coast before a change over to mixed precipitation and rain. Snowfall rates of 1 inch per hour are possible even if only for a couple of hours. This will make travel hazardous as roads become slippery.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
